New Records: Jaden Hardy scored a season-high 25 points, including a season-high four 3-pointers in the second quarter.
Dallas Mavericks clinched the season series against the Portland Trail Blazers 3-1.
Mavericks are now 22-16 with two upcoming games against the Denver Nuggets.
Key Match Events: Mavericks trailed by as many as 12 points but rallyd in the fourth quarter to tie the game at 109 with 2:26 left.
P.J. Washington made two free throws to tie the game and later drained a go-ahead corner 3-pointer.
Quentin Grimes made a three-point play to seal the victory.
Jaden Hardy led the Mavericks with a season-high 25 points.
Pre-Game Insights: The game start time was moved up an hour due to snowy weather.
Blazers coach Chauncey Billups was aware of Hardy's recent surge from beyond the 3-point line.
Mavericks coach Jason Kidd addressed the earlier tipoff time during his pregame press conference.
Post-Match Reflections: Mavericks coach Jason Kidd highlighted the victory as a crucial step toward the championship.
The Blazers will return home to face the Heat on Saturday, while the Mavericks will host the Denver Nuggets in the first of two consecutive games on Sunday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The first 5,000 fans in attendance who braved the weather conditions received Daniel Gafford pins.
The NBA also postponed Thursdayâ€™s game between the Lakers and Charlotte Hornets because of the fierce wildfires raving across Los Angeles.
